sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Franklin Templeton's State Municipal Bond ETFs Hit The Market, Offering Tax-Free Income, Low Fees
feed.summary: Franklin Templeton has launched five new single-state municipal income ETFs, providing investors with targeted exposure to tax-free income opportunities. These ETFs, which converted from Putnam funds, offer competitive 0.35% annual expense ratios and aim to provide high levels of income exempt from federal and state personal income tax. The move caters to investors seeking stable, tax-efficient income and reflects the growing demand for localized municipal ETF exposure.
